Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is unnecessary as existing laws can address the issues of misinformation and disinformation.
The bill is an attack on human rights, particularly freedom of speech, and resembles authoritarian measures seen in regimes like North Korea or Stalin's USSR.
Defining 'misinformation' is subjective and problematic, raising concerns about government overreach and censorship.
The government's handling of COVID-19 was itself a source of misinformation and disinformation, and a parliamentary inquiry into this is needed instead of new legislation.
Notable Quotes: There is NO NEED to do anything!
The proposed bill undermines freedom of speech by attempting to ‘balance’ that fundamental right with the notion of combating so-called 'misinformation'.
If this Bill passes, we could re-name the Australian Communications and Media Authority as the 'Ministry of Truth'.
